marketNews.title: Government Targets +45% YoY Foreign Tourist Visits in 2024
marketNews.content: The Minister of Tourism and Creative Economy, Sandiaga Uno, increased the target for foreign tourist (wisman) visits to Indonesia in 2024 from 14.3 million to 17 million. This target is 45.5% higher than the 2023 realization of 11.68 million visits. Sandiaga stated that the increased target for 2024 is based on the solid 2023 realization, where foreign tourist visits grew by 98.3% YoY and exceeded (137.4%) the target of 8.5 million. Based on BPS data, the foreign tourists visiting Indonesia during 2023 were dominated by 5 countries, namely Malaysia (1.9 million), Australia (1.43 million), Singapore (1.41 million), China (787,924), and Timor Leste (728,586). The average duration of foreign tourist visits ranged between 7-12 nights. Meanwhile, the hotel occupancy rate in Indonesia rose by 2.84 percentage points in 2023 to 59.74%. Sandiaga is optimistic that the tourism sector can support Indonesia's economic growth in 2024, which is targeted to reach 5.2%. Several initiatives planned to boost foreign tourist visits in 2024 include increasing the number of events and flights, as well as granting visa exemptions for entry to 20 countries outside of Southeast Asia. Although foreign tourist visits far exceeded the 2023 target, Kompas reported that domestic tourist (wisnus) mobility during 2023 is unlikely to reach the target of 1.2-1.4 billion trips. As of yet, BPS has not released the number of domestic tourist movements for 2023. However, based on data up to 11M23, the number of domestic tourist movements reached only 668.9 million trips. This realization increased by 12% YoY, but only met 55.7% of the minimum target. Sandiaga could not comment on the 2023 domestic tourist travel data, as the data is still being finalized by BPS. The Ministry of Tourism and Creative Economy targets domestic tourist mobility in 2024 to reach 1.25-1.5 billion trips. To achieve this target, Kompas reports that the ministry will collaborate with the Ministry of Transportation to suppress air ticket prices, which have been a concern for domestic tourists. Key Takeaway The 2024 foreign tourist visit target is higher than the pre-pandemic foreign tourist visits, which reached 16.1 million in 2019. If this target is achieved, the increase in foreign tourist visits may have a positive impact on tourism-related issuers such as GIAA, PANR, and BAYU. The increase in the number of foreign tourists also has the potential to increase alcohol consumption in Indonesia, which could be a positive catalyst for alcoholic beverage issuers such as WINE, MLBI, DLTA, and BEER. You can learn more about alcohol beverage issuer analysis through this Mini Unboxing. On the other hand, the realization of foreign tourist visits in 2024 will face several challenges, one of which is the general election. We see a safe and conducive political situation throughout the election year as an absolute requirement for the foreign tourist visit target to be achieved.

marketNews.title: OECD Outlook Projects Global Economic Growth to Reach +2.9% in 2024
marketNews.content: The latest outlook from the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD) projects global economic growth in 2024 to reach +2.9%, higher than the November 2023 outlook of +2.7%. This projected increase is driven by the US economy, which is expected to remain strong amid potential interest rate cuts and declining inflation. The latest OECD outlook projects US economic growth in 2024 to reach +2.1%, higher than the previous outlook of +1.5%.

marketNews.title: President Jokowi Orders Temporary Budget Block for Ministries/Agencies Ahead of 2024 Presidential Election
marketNews.content: President Joko Widodo ordered the Minister of Finance, Sri Mulyani, to implement a temporary block (automatic adjustment) on ministry or agency budgets amounting to 50.14 trillion rupiah ahead of the 2024 presidential election. The Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, stated that the funds collected from this budget blocking will be used to increase the budget for social assistance and fertilizer subsidies.

marketNews.title: DPR Speaker Received Presidential Letter Regarding the Special Region of Jakarta Bill (RUU DKJ)
marketNews.content: The Speaker of the House of Representatives (DPR RI), Puan Maharani, stated that she has received the president's letter regarding the Draft Law on the Special Region of Jakarta (DKJ). One of the proposed points in the DKJ Draft Law draft is the plan for the Governor and Vice Governor of Jakarta to be elected by the president after Jakarta no longer holds the status of the capital city. This draft has been approved by the DPR RI Legislation Body to be discussed at the next level.

marketNews.title: KPPU Investigates Alleged Monopoly Practices by Shopee and Google in Indonesia
marketNews.content: The Business Competition Supervisory Commission (KPPU) is investigating alleged monopoly practices carried out by Shopee and Google in Indonesia. The Chairman of KPPU, M. Fanshurullah Asa, stated that Google Indonesia is suspected of engaging in monopoly practices in the payment service process using Google Pay. Meanwhile, Shopee Indonesia is suspected of monopolizing goods delivery services from its marketplace by using Shopee Express.

tickerNews.title: DMAS Targets Conservative Marketing Sales of IDR 1.81 Trillion in 2024
tickerNews.content: Puradelta Lestari targets marketing sales of IDR 1.81 trillion in 2024 (vs. 2023 target: IDR 1.8 trillion), which is 3.2% lower than the 2023 realization of IDR 1.87 trillion. The Director and Corporate Secretary of DMAS, Tondy Suwanto, stated that this more conservative target takes into account national economic growth and the global geopolitical situation. Tondy also mentioned that they have recorded land demand of 90 hectares in early 2024.

tickerNews.title: PTPP Records New Contract Value of IDR 3.5 Trillion in January 2024
tickerNews.content: PTPP recorded a new contract value of IDR 3.5 trillion in January 2024, growing by 99.96% YoY. This realization is equivalent to about 10.5% of the 2024 target indication of approximately IDR 33.3 trillion. New contracts during January 2024 were dominated by projects from the government at 90.5%, followed by State-Owned Enterprises (7.76%) and the private sector (1.74%).

tickerNews.title: Bridge Leed Limited Increases MMLP Stake via Share Purchase
tickerNews.content: Mega Manunggal Property shareholder, Bridge Leed Limited, purchased 200 million MMLP shares from Provident Warehouse Pte. Ltd. at a price of IDR 300 per share on January 23, 2024. The total transaction value reached IDR 60 billion. After this transaction, Bridge Leed Limited's ownership in MMLP increased from 14.61% to 17.51%.

tickerNews.title: Hengtong Optic-Electric International Announces Mandatory Tender Offer for VOKS Shares
tickerNews.content: The new controller of Voksel Electric, Hengtong Optic-Electric International Co., Ltd., announced it will conduct a mandatory tender offer for up to 1.12 billion (26.95%) VOKS shares at a price of IDR 226 per share from February 6 to March 6, 2024. The maximum value of this corporate action reaches IDR 253.1 billion. This tender offer follows Hengtong Optic-Electric International Co., Ltd. officially acquiring 42.97% of VOKS shares valued at IDR 403.56 billion.

tickerNews.title: AMMN Smelter and Precious Metal Refinery Construction Progress Reaches 70%+ as of December 2023
tickerNews.content: The construction progress for the copper smelter and precious metal refinery owned by Amman Mineral Internasional's subsidiary, PT Amman Mineral Industri, reached 76.1% and 72.7%, respectively, as of December 2023, according to independent verifiers. The Vice President of Corporate Communications and Investor Relations of AMMN, Kartika Octaviana, stated that they are confident both projects will be completed on target by the end of May 2024. The smelter project will produce 222,000 tons of copper cathodes and 830,000 tons of sulfuric acid per year, while the precious metal refinery will produce 18 tons of gold bars, 55 tons of silver bars, and 70 tons of selenium per year.
